Write an essay on one of the following. You must base your answer on the cultural options or literary
options you have studied in class. References to other subjects or literary works are permissible but should
not form the main body of your answer.

Language and culture

1.    Politically sensitive language is language which shows an awareness of another person’s physical,
      mental, cultural, or gender differences. Discuss whether politically sensitive language is necessary
      or unnecessary.


2.    Is the notion of “one language, one world” a good idea or a bad idea? Consider what might be gained
      or lost if the world’s languages were replaced by one world language.



Media and culture

3.    New technology is having a profound impact on the survival of some mass media. Can they survive?
      Discuss this with reference to your study of this option.


4.    Does the media (whether advertising or journalism) have a responsibility to the public? Discuss with
      reference to your study of this option.



Future issues

5.    Technology can sometimes be used to make society safer. With this in mind, consider the relationship
      of technology to public safety in the future and what the positive and/or negative side-effects
      might be.



Global issues

6.    Global concerns should take priority over local or national ones. Discuss whether you agree or
      disagree with this statement in reference to your study of this option.



Social issues

7.    Can education help solve social problems? Discuss, with reference to at least one social issue you
      have studied.

Literary questions

8.    Joss Whedon has said “passion is the source of our finest moments. The joy of love … the clarity of
      hatred … and the ecstasy of grief ”. Discuss the role of passion in at least two works you have studied.


9.    “Coming of age” stories are ones which present the psychological, moral, and social shaping of
      a character. Discuss how characters develop in at least two works you have studied.


10.   Discuss the role of religion in at least two works you have studied. How is religion important to the
      works’ central ideas or themes?
